themes: insufficient transparency in feedback and decision-making
exclusion of programs from funding cycles
perceived disrespect and lack of support for artists
key_phrases: Professional panelists who are held accountable to the stated guidelines
the SAME panelist TWO years in a row
I was never given any of the data that was collected from those sessions
I did not receive any explanation of how our feedback was going to be included
no funding in 2025 for programs running Oct - Dec of 2025
Our major program this year is in November. It did not qualify for funding last round, and now it is going to be 'skipped'
Don't ask us to give you more feedback if you haven't read all of the feedback WE HAVE ALREADY given you
DON'T CHANGE FUNDING GUIDELINES with less than a year of warning
Treat artists with respect and professionalism
barriers_identified: lack of transparency in how feedback is used
poor communication about funding cycles and changes
exclusion of programs from funding due to scheduling
solutions_proposed: Increase transparency by sharing data and explaining how feedback is used
Provide timely and direct communication about funding changes
Avoid last-minute changes to funding guidelines
Treat artists with respect and professionalism
